Australian writer Yang Hengjun sentenced by Beijing court - friendA Beijing court on Monday handed Australian writer Yang Hengjun a suspended death sentence, a family friend said, five years after he was first detained in China and three years after a closed-door trial on espionage charges. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 02:45:54 GMT HMTNVGUQQBO4DHC5X2SVEIGOYY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/australian-yang-hengjun-handed-suspended-death-sentence-by-beijing-court-2024-02-05/Reuters世界亚太地区
Insight: China bets on open-source chips as US export controls mountWhen a Beijing-based military institute in September published a patent for a new high-performance chip, it offered a glimpse of China's bid to remake the half-trillion dollar global chip market and withstand U.S. sanctions. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 02:11:30 GMT DNGTDML65RIA3BKNXB54QNIOT4 https://www.reuters.com/technology/china-bets-open-source-chips-us-export-controls-mount-2024-02-05/Eduardo Baptista技术
Investors dig into India's stock market as China flounders, discount risksIndia's $4 trillion stock market is pulling in billions of dollars of domestic and foreign money as investors flock to a fast-growing alternative to China, brushing aside risks around overpriced shares, upcoming elections and regulatory uncertainty. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 02:07:45 GMT WVQAH7OV65NUNHPAC6TEKATCGY https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/investors-into-india-stock-market-china-flounders-discount-risks-2024-02-05/Jaspreet Kalra, Jayshree Pyasi市场宏观问题
Asian stocks slump as traders dial back rate cut betsAsian shares fell on Monday and the dollar climbed after a robust U.S. jobs report dashed any expectations of a near-term interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve, while stocks in China stocks remained on the back foot on weak sentiment. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 02:05:36 GMT MHMKNFHE7FO5JOSVLTSHE25ZBU https://www.reuters.com/markets/global-markets-wrapup-1-2024-02-05/Ankur Banerjee市场
China's Jan services activity expands at slower pace - Caixin PMIChina's services activity expanded at a slightly slower pace in January as new orders fell, a private-sector survey showed on Monday, suggesting a soft start for the world's No.2 economy amid tepid demand and a property slump. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 01:59:19 GMT G7BMAIDKCBIJZPX3GHJCBGPD3Y https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/chinas-non-services-activity-expands-slower-pace-caixin-pmi-2024-02-05/Reuters市场宏观问题
Dollar scales fresh peaks as Fed cut bets recedeThe dollar rose to an eight-week high against its major peers on Monday as traders clawed back bets for aggressive rate cuts by the Federal Reserve this year in view of a still-resilient U.S. economy. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 01:25:53 GMT HZ5OVIQTQNMEDOWPBSAEJ2462U https://www.reuters.com/markets/currencies/dollar-scales-fresh-peaks-fed-cut-bets-recede-2024-02-05/Rae Wee市场货币
China regulator approves joint venture set up by Mercedes-Benz and BMW BrillianceChina's market regulator approved a joint venture set up by Mercedes-Benz (China) Investment Limited and BMW Brilliance Automotive Ltd, the State Administration for Market Regulation said in a statement released on Sunday. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 00:55:32 GMT RJ7NEI67IZNKDABA7VEVFI35IU https://www.reuters.com/markets/deals/china-regulator-approves-joint-venture-set-up-by-mercedes-benz-bmw-brilliance-2024-02-05/Reuters市场交易
US official urges Papua New Guinea to reject Chinese security dealA senior U.S. state department official urged Papua New Guinea(PNG) to turn down China's offer of a potential security pact, warning the Pacific nation that any security guarantee with Beijing comes with consequences and costs. Sun, 04 Feb 2024 23:53:59 GMT WCVUIM6JAJIPDB6LRJNEM3PPQY https://www.reuters.com/world/us-official-urges-papua-new-guinea-reject-chinese-security-deal-2024-02-04/Reuters世界
US Senate unveils $118 billion bipartisan bill on border security with aid for Ukraine, IsraelThe U.S. Senate on Sunday unveiled a $118 billion bipartisan border security bill that would also provide aid to Ukraine and Israel following months of negotiations, but the measure faces an uncertain future amid opposition by Donald Trump and hardline Republicans. China's tumbling prices push some exporters to the brinkProlonged factory deflation is threatening the survival of smaller Chinese exporters. Exclusive: Eisai expects 1,500 Alzheimer's patients in China launch, sees ‘huge’ growthJapan’s Eisai aims to roll out its groundbreaking Alzheimer’s drug Leqembi to 1,500 people in China later this year, but expects growth to accelerate significantly in 2025 as diagnosis methods change, a company spokesperson told Reuters.
